result.execSummary:
The defendant Parker S Wiersema was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Parker S Wiersema is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Parker S Wiersema was found guilty of Criminal Damage to Property, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Judge Mangerson presiding. Deft present in person w/ Atty Richards. ADA Breedlove present for State. Ct #1 - Plea of no contest. Rights given. Found guilty. Sentence withheld, probation for 12 MO with conditions: 1) Not to go on parent's premises in Wisconsin unless they give consent  2) AODA assessment and follow through  3) Costs  4) Deft may petition for expunction upon successful completion of probation.  50 days credit on revocation.  Ct #2 - Dismissed on State's motion: Granted.
